solution_line_template: There are {fries_likers} - {both_likers} = <<{fries_likers}-{both_likers}={fries_only}>>{fries_only} students who like French fries only.
There are {burger_likers} - {both_likers} = <<{burger_likers}-{both_likers}={burgers_only}>>{burgers_only} students who like burgers only.
So, {fries_only} + {burgers_only} + {both_likers} = <<{fries_only}+{burgers_only}+{both_likers}={total_likers}>>{total_likers} students like either French fries, burgers, or both.
Hence, {total_students} - {total_likers} = <<{total_students}-{total_likers}={neither}>>{neither} students do not like either fries or burgers.
